intro: Oenone kochii, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Oenone kochii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in meadows and open woodlands.
